definition: to follow through/to carry through to the end
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash

sentences.english: We should carry through the principle of plain living and hard struggle.
sentences.chinese: 艰苦奋斗的精神要贯彻始终。

sentences.english: The past, present and future, are only illusions , however persistent.
sentences.chinese: 过去，现在，未来，无论怎样贯彻始终，都是幻觉。

sentences.english: I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to the light I have.
sentences.chinese: 我不一定求成功，但定必言行如一，贯彻始终。

sentences.english: Mr. Bush keeps his stay-the-course strategy for the war in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 布希先生对伊拉克战争，坚守贯彻始终的对策。

sentences.english: I thank you for what you did, and ask you to stay the course. Applause.
sentences.chinese: 我为你所做的感谢你和请求你贯彻始终。

definition: to implement/to put into practice/to carry out
to take orders/to receive commands/to carry on (a tradition)
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth/to carry things through/I started, so I'll finish.
